page.title: 07BIOGRAPHY:MRS TAYLOR
page.content: IN DECEMBER 1985 MRS TAYLOR WILL HAVE LIVED IN BRAMLEY FOR 89 YEARS.SHE DESCRIBED BRAMLEY AS IT WAS WHEN SHE WAS YOUNG. THERE USED TO BE A LOVLEY VILAGE FARM WHERE CATTLE WERE KEPT.MILK,BUTTER AND CHEESE WERE PRODUCED ON THE FARM.ALL THE HOUSES IN BRAMLEY WERE LITTLE COTTAGES.IN BRAMLEY THERE WERE TEXTILE AND MECHANICAL FACTORIES.ON TOWN END THERE WERE 19 SHOPS WHICH SOLD ALMOST ANYTHING.ATTHE AGE OF THREE MRS TAYLOR BEGAN STANNINGLY COUNCIL MIXED SCHOOL.AT 13 SHE STAYED AT HOME TO LOOK AFTER THE FAMILY WHILE HER MOTHER WENT TO WORK IN A MILL.THERE WAS NO END OF GREEN FIELDS THAT GREW RHUBARB.POOR PEOPLE PAYED HALF A CROWN A WEEK TO PAY THE DOCTORS FEE AS THERE WAS NO N.H.S.THERE WERE 7 CHURCHES WHICH PROVIDED ENTERTAINMENT FOR THE PEOPLE.
